member.name: T:EZGO.Api.Controllers.Base.BaseController`1
member.summary:
BaseController(Of T); used for base of each controller in the project. This class contains a basic route named health that can be called on controller level (for external monitoring), it contains basic functionality for checking if static output is needed and it sets and gets the basic Logger and CurrentApplicationUser.
Make sure when you implement a new controller that you will add this base class.
All routes within the controllers must implement the IActionResult as output. So we can add statuses with our responses.
NOTE! all controllers must inherit from this controller and are therefor default authorized. If unauthorized access is needed add [AllowAnonymous] to the route.

member.name: P:EZGO.Api.Controllers.Base.BaseController`1.UseStaticOutput
member.summary: UseStaticOutput; calls CheckStaticOutput which checks the QueryString if static is available and true, if so returns true or false so a static string located in StaticOutput.

member.name: P:EZGO.Api.Controllers.Base.BaseController`1.CurrentApplicationUser
member.summary: CurrentApplicationUser; current application used is the user that is currently connecting with the API based on the user Token that is supplied within the headers of the call. The user contains basic information like its CompanyId. NOTE! the user is only filled when 1) the token supplied exists. 2) the right constructor is used with implementation.

member.name: T:EZGO.Api.Controllers.GEN4.TasksController

GetTasks; main tasks call. Full filters available.

member.name: M:EZGO.Api.Controllers.GEN4.TasksController.GetTasksByDay(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: GetTasksByDay; Will return all task related to the date in timestamp. timestamp will be set to today if not supplied.
member.param: If this timestamp is supplied all tasks for the days between both timestamps are returned

member.summary:
GetTasksToday; Will return ALL tasks that have a start_at date on TODAY. Start datetime and end datetime will be calculated based on either the timestamp supplied or based on now server time converted to company timezone. If needed specific filters can be used, no filters are required. This route can be used as a short form, result can also be retrieved on the /tasks route.
The return data is based on paged data and will default to 200 items. Afterwards can be retrieved per x-number of items. Limit 0 or larger that 200 will not be supported.
The returned data will consist of all tasks, of all types that need to be started/finished today based on the company shift times.
NOTE! logic not fully finished, weirdness can occur.
member.param: WILL BE IGNORED
WILL BE IGNORED
WILL BE IGNORED
If set to True results will have deduplicated shift tasks

member.summary:
GetTasksShift; Get tasks current shift. Current shift is based on the timeset of the company Start-datetime and end-datetime will be calculated based on either the timestamp supplied or based on now server time converted to company timezone. If needed specific filters can be used, no filters are required. This route can be used as a short form, result can also be retrieved on the /tasks route.
The return data is based on paged data and will default to 200 items. Afterwards can be retrieved per x-number of items. Limit 0 or larger that 200 will not be supported.
The returned data will consist of all tasks, of all types that need to be started/finished in this shift based on the company shift times.
NOTE! logic not fully finished, weirdness can occur.
member.param: WILL BE IGNORED
WILL BE IGNORED
WILL BE IGNORED

member.summary:
GetTasksThisWeek; Will return ALL tasks that have a start_at date on this WEEK (start on monday) Start-datetime and end-datetime will be calculated based on either the timestamp supplied or based on now server time converted to company timezone. If needed specific filters can be used, no filters are required. This route can be used as a short form, result can also be retrieved on the /tasks route.
The return data is based on paged data and will default to 200 items. Afterwards can be retrieved per x-number of items. Limit 0 or larger that 200 will not be supported.
NOTE! logic not fully finished, weirdness can occur.
member.param: WILL BE IGNORED
WILL BE IGNORED
WILL BE IGNORED
If set to True results will have deduplicated future tasks
If set to True results will have the overdue tasks removed

member.summary:
GetTasksThisMonth; Will return ALL tasks that have a start_at date on this month (start on 1st of month) Start-datetime and end-datetime will be calculated based on either the timestamp supplied or based on now server time converted to company timezone. If needed specific filters can be used, no filters are required. This route can be used as a short form, result can also be retrieved on the /tasks route.
The return data is based on paged data and will default to 200 items. Afterwards can be retrieved per x-number of items. Limit 0 or larger that 200 will not be supported.
NOTE! logic not fully finished, weirdness can occur.
member.param: WILL BE IGNORED
WILL BE IGNORED
WILL BE IGNORED

member.summary:
GetTasksOverdue; Get all overdue tasks based on the current date (timestamp).
The return data is based on paged data and will default to 200 items. Afterwards can be retrieved per x-number of items. Limit 0 or page size that 200 will not be supported.
Will return a list of all tasks, of all types (that can be overdue), containing tasks that are not finished yet which do not have a alternative task scheduled for today.
NOTE! logic not fully finished, weirdness can occur.

GetTasksTypeWeekly; Get all tasks of type weekly
The return data is based on paged data and will default to 200 items. Afterwards can be retrieved per x-number of items. Limit 0 or page size larger that 200 will not be supported.
The returned data will consist of all tasks of type WEEK that need to be started/finished this week based on the company shift times. The time frame can be overridden with a start and end time stamp.
Weekly tasks will map current week for retrieval; Monday till Sunday by default. Shift calculations will be added if needed. If you want a specific time-frame use the starttimestamp and endtimestamp. All retrieval will be mapped against the task.start_at time.

GetTasksMonthly; Get all tasks of type monthly or month
The return data is based on paged data and will default to 200 items. Afterwards can be retrieved per x-number of items. Limit 0 or page size larger that 200 will not be supported.
The returned data will consist of all tasks of type MONTH that need to be started/finished this WEEK based on the company shift times. The time frame can be overridden with a start and end time stamp.
Monthly tasks will map current week for retrieval; Monday till Sunday by default. Shift calculations will be added if needed. If you want a specific time-frame use the starttimestamp and endtimestamp. All retrieval will be mapped against the task.start_at time.

GetTasksCounts; Gets count object containing several counts for use in display. Same filters can be used as the normal tasks calls Note! depending on parameters some counts are maybe not filled. Note! when counting overdue tasks some filter might be ignored.

member.name: M:EZGO.Api.Controllers.General.MigrationsController.FixDataActionCommentActionResolved
member.summary: FixDataActionCommentActionResolved; Fixed the action comment that were missing and not send. This route needs to be called with an administrator user and called until no-more items are updated. When this happens it should return a 410 (resource gone) and as message 0. Until then it should return an OK and result he number of inserted records. Records are added by 100 items per call.

member.name: M:EZGO.Api.Controllers.General.MigrationsController.FixDataAuditingLogForAuditTemplates
member.summary: This is a fix for auditing records of audit templates where the audit template was deleted (set inactive). Fixes original object json in data auditing records where the original object json is not the audit template. Fixes 100 records, if the returned value is less than 100, that means all targetted records are now fixed. Can be run again but would have no effect and return 0.

member.name: M:EZGO.Api.Controllers.General.MigrationsController.FixDataAuditingLogForWorkInstructionTemplateItems
member.summary: This is a fix for auditing records of work instruction items where the original object was never logged. Fills original object json in data auditing records where the original object json is empty with the mutated object of the previous recorded mutation. Fixes 100 records, if the returned value is less than 100, that means all targetted records are now fixed. Can be run again but would have no effect and return 0.

member.name: M:EZGO.Api.Controllers.General.MigrationsController.MigrationFlattenCompanyTemplates(System.Int32)
member.summary: Run flattenprocess manually for a company, this is an fall back method in case of automatic process doesn't function propertly.

member.name: T:EZGO.Api.Controllers.V1.ActionsController
member.summary: ActionsController; contains all routes based on action this includes Actions, single Action, Comments and single Comments.

members.member:
GetActions -> retrieve actions based on several parameters.
filtertext: the action id, action text and comment text can be searched (not the action comments) status filters isresolved: checks whether is_resolved is true isoverdue: takes the current date time, adds one day and compares that to the action due date (due date before now+1day) isunresolved: takes the current date time and compares that to the action due date (due date after now) end status filters hasunviewedcomments: checks if the actions have unviewed comments for the user obtaining the actions assignedToMe: returns actions for the 'assigned to me' filter. contains actions whith user in resources or an allowed area for the user in resources createdByOrAssignedToMe: returns my actions (either created by current user or action has assigned users containing this user) createdbyid: checks if the action was created by createdbyid taskid: checks if the action taskid equals this parameter taskid: checks if the action taskid equals this parameter tagids: checks if any of the tags supplied in this parameter are added to an action (format: 1,2,3) assigneduserid: checks if the assigned users contains the assigneduserid assigneduserids: checks if the assigned users contains any of the assigneduserids (format: 1,2,3) Not used assignedareaid: checks if the assigned areas contains the assignedareaid assignedareaids: checks if the assigned areas contains any of the assignedareaids (format: 1,2,3) timestamp: checks if the created at is before the timestamp (format: dd-MM-yyyy HH:mm:ss) createdfrom: checks (only if createdto also filled in) if the action was created at or after the createdfrom, but at or before the createdto (format: dd-MM-yyyy) createdto: checks (only if createdfrom also filled in) if the action was created at or after the createdfrom, but at or before the createdto (format: dd-MM-yyyy) resolvedfrom: checks (only if resolvedto also filled in) if the action was resolved at or after the resolvedfrom, but at or before the resolvedto (format: dd-MM-yyyy) resolvedto: checks (only if resolvedfrom also filled in) if the action was resolved at or after the resolvedfrom, but at or before the resolvedto (format: dd-MM-yyyy) overduefrom: checks (only if overdueto also filled in) if the action was overdue at or after the overduefrom, but at or before the overdueto (format: dd-MM-yyyy) overdueto: checks (only if overduefrom also filled in) if the action was overdue at or after the overduefrom, but at or before the overdueto (format: dd-MM-yyyy) resolvedcutoffdate: Will not return resolved actions that are resolved before the provided date. Results will include actions resolved on the provided date. (format: dd-MM-yyyy) checklistid: id of the checklist connected to the actions checklisttemplateid: id of the checklist template connected to the actions auditid: id of the audit connected to the actions audittemplateid: id of the audit template connected to the actions include: possible values are unviewedcommentnr, mainparent, assignedareas, assignedusers, userinformation, tags limit: limit the maximum amount of actions that this call returns offset: skip the first x results and return the next limit amount of actions Returns a IActionResult containing a list of actions. Collection of actions Filters didn't pass validation No rights to retrieve the list of actions.

GetActionCounts -> retrieves several action counts based on the same filters and structures as the normal action calls. When retrieving with no parameters it will retrieve the counts based on no filters.
filtertext: the action id, action text and comment text can be searched (not the action comments) status filters isresolved: checks whether is_resolved is true isoverdue: takes the current date time, adds one day and compares that to the action due date (due date before now+1day) isunresolved: takes the current date time and compares that to the action due date (due date after now) end status filters hasunviewedcomments: checks if the actions have unviewed comments for the user obtaining the actions assignedToMe: returns actions for the 'assigned to me' filter. contains actions whith user in resources or an allowed area for the user in resources createdByOrAssignedToMe: returns my actions (either created by current user or action has assigned users containing this user) createdbyid: checks if the action was created by createdbyid taskid: checks if the action taskid equals this parameter taskid: checks if the action taskid equals this parameter tagids: checks if any of the tags supplied in this parameter are added to an action (format: 1,2,3) assigneduserid: checks if the assigned users contains the assigneduserid assigneduserids: checks if the assigned users contains any of the assigneduserids (format: 1,2,3) Not used assignedareaid: checks if the assigned areas contains the assignedareaid assignedareaids: checks if the assigned areas contains any of the assignedareaids (format: 1,2,3) timestamp: checks if the created at is before the timestamp (format: dd-MM-yyyy HH:mm:ss) createdfrom: checks (only if createdto also filled in) if the action was created at or after createdto (format: dd-MM-yyyy) resolvedfrom: checks (only if resolvedto also filled in) if the action was resolved at or after the resolvedfrom, but at or before the resolvedto (format: dd-MM-yyyy) Results will include actions resolved on the provided date. (format: dd-MM-yyyy) checklistid: id of the checklist connected to the actions checklisttemplateid: id of the checklist template connected to the actions auditid: id of the audit connected to the actions audittemplateid: id of the audit template connected to the actions include: possible values are unviewedcommentnr, mainparent, assignedareas, assignedusers, userinformation, tags limit: limit the maximum amount of actions that this call returns offset: skip the first x results and return the next limit amount of actions Returns a IActionResult containing a ActionCountStatistics. ActionCountStatistic item Filters didn't pass validation No rights to retrieve the list of actions.
GetActionCounts -> retrieves several action counts based on the same filters and structures as the normal action calls. When retrieving with no parameters it will retrieve the counts based on no filters.

GetActionRelations -> retrieves several lsit of action relation items based on the same filters and structures as the normal action calls. The following relations can be found within the collection: task_id, task_template_id, checklist_id , audit_id

adds one day and compares that to the action due date (due date before now+1day) isunresolved: takes the current date time and compares that to the action due date (due date after now) end status in resources or an allowed area for the user in resources createdByOrAssignedToMe: returns my actions (either created by current user or action has assigned users containing this user) createdbyid: List of ActionRelation items collection Filters didn't pass validation No rights to retrieve the list of actions.

GetActionsMy -> retrieve my actions based on several parameters. createdByOrAssignedToMe will be set to current user id
filtertext: the action id, action text and comment text can be searched (not the action comments) status filters isresolved: checks whether is_resolved is true isoverdue: takes the current date time, adds one day and compares that to the action due date (due date before now+1day) isunresolved: takes the current date time and compares that to the action due date (due date after now) end status in resources or an allowed area for the user in resources createdbyid: checks if the action was created by createdbyid taskid: checks if the action taskid equals this parameter taskid: checks if the member.name: M:EZGO.Api.Controllers.V1.ActionsController.AddAction(EZGO.Api.Models.ActionsAction)
member.summary: AddAction -> Add an action. The following rules must be met: - The company that is connected to the action must be the company that executes the check. - The userId that created the item is the same user that executes the check (unless ignoreUserIdCheck is true). - The Comment should be filled and can not contain script related tags and filters out html tags so they are filtered out if filled. - The Description can not contain script related tags and filters out html tags so they are filtered out if filled - The Images should contain valid media UriParts - The Videos should contain valid media UriParts - The VideoThumbnails should contain valid media UriParts
member.param: ActionAction object, containing all data for that specific action.
member.returns: Will return an int containing the action id.
member.response: Forbidden, no rights to process the action, company id possibly invalid.

member.name: M:EZGO.Api.Controllers.V1.ActionsController.ChangeAction(System.Int32,EZGO.Api.Models.ActionsAction)
member.summary: ChangeAction -> Add an action. The following rules must be met: - The company that is connected to the action must be the company that executes the check. - The Comment should be filled and can not contain script related tags and filters out html tags so they are filtered out if filled. - The Description can not contain script related tags and filters out html tags so they are filtered out if filled - The Images should contain valid media UriParts - The Videos should contain valid media UriParts - The VideoThumbnails should contain valid media UriParts
member.param: Action id of the action that is being updated.
member.response: Forbidden, no rights to process the action, company id possibly invalid.

member.name: M:EZGO.Api.Controllers.V1.ActionsController.GetActionsHealth
member.summary: GetActionsHealth; Checks the basic action functionality by running a part of the logic with specific id's. Depending on result this route will return a true / false and a httpstatus. This route can be used for remote monitoring partial functionalities of the API.

member.summary: GetActionCommentsHealth; Checks the basic actioncomment functionality by running a part of the logic with specific id's. Depending on result this route will return a true / false and a httpstatus. This route can be used for remote monitoring partial functionalities of the API.

member.summary: Shares an audit tempalte with other companies. The template will be shared in it's current state. The other companies will get the checklist in an inbox, to be accepted or declined.

member.name: T:EZGO.Api.Controllers.V1.AuthenticationController
member.summary: AuthenticationController; contains all routes based on authentication. All logout, login and validate token parts are located within this controller.

member.name: M:EZGO.Api.Controllers.V1.AuthenticationController.Login(EZGO.Api.Models.Authentication.Login)
member.summary: Login; Main access route for getting acc token. NOTE! there is a specific hammer protection based on the UserName, depending on settings only a number of times within a certain time frame a login request for a specific UserName can be done.
member.param: Login object based on Login model within the API models.

member.name: M:EZGO.Api.Controllers.V1.AuthenticationController.AutoLogin(System.String)
member.summary: External login; Used for getting token through a external login. Depending on the source (e.g. MSAL, Google) will be validated through several structures.
member.param: JWT token containing external information. Based on external login structure.
member.returns: Internal access token also based on JWT

member.name: M:EZGO.Api.Controllers.V1.AuthenticationController.AutoLoginV2(EZGO.Api.Models.Authentication.ExternalLogin)
member.summary: AutoLogin method above. This is a overload for that method for directly parsing the external login object.

member.name: M:EZGO.Api.Controllers.V1.CommentsController.GetComments(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: GetComments -> retrieve comments based on several parameters.
member.param: filtertext: the action id, action text and comment text can be searched (not the action comments)
userid: the user that created the comment
taskid: the id of the task linked to this comment
tasktemplateid: the id of the tasktemplate linked to this comment
tagids: checks if any of the tags supplied in this parameter are added to an action (format: 1,2,3)
limit: limit the maximum amount of comments that this call returns
offset: skip the first x results and return the next limit amount of comments
include: the only include value that is supported for comments is 'tags'
createdfrom: checks (only if createdto also filled in) if the comment was created at or after the createdfrom, but at or before the createdto (format: dd-MM-yyyy)
createdto: checks (only if createdfrom also filled in) if the comment was created at or after the createdfrom, but at or before the createdto (format: dd-MM-yyyy)
timestamp: checks if the comment date is before the timestamp (format: dd-MM-yyyy HH:mm:ss)

member.name: M:EZGO.Api.Controllers.V1.CommentsController.GetCommentsRelations(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: GetCommentsRelations; Retrieved comment relations, will return a list of commentid, taskid, tasktemplateid and if available checklist/auditid Can be used with same filters as commetns call if needed to get specific sets.

member.name: M:EZGO.Api.Controllers.V1.CommentsController.GetCommentsCounts(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: GetCommentsCounts; Retrieved statistics object for comments. Can be used with same filters as commetns call if needed to get specific sets.

member.name: M:EZGO.Api.Controllers.V1.LoggingController.LogAnomalyData(System.Object)
member.summary: LogAnomaly; Log possible anomalies that occur within the client applications. These will include, possible connection anomalies, local validation issues etc.
member.param: List of objects, preferable: List of anomaly objects . List of string can be posted and differently handles, route will more or less parse anything as long as it is a list of 'something'
member.returns: true/false depending on outcome, can be ignored by client.
member.response: true/false, can be ignored by client.
